reference.title: Tagging XML
reference.shortdesc: The CWRC-Writer allows editors of documents to mark up or embed semantic tags in documents using Extensible Markup Language (XML).

refbody.section: Introduction to tagging XMLCWRC-Writer uses both the terms markup and tag to describe the embedding of XML (Extensible Markup Language) tags within the text of a document according to a predefined structure or schema. (For a gentel introduction to XML see http://www.w3schools.com/xml/). The markup or encoding makes the tagged features of the document available for search, analysis, and formatting while also ensuring that the text remains in a readily preservable format.

Document templates and sample documents contain some basic tags. The exisiting markup in your active document can be seen in the Markup panel. For more information see . You can add text to or delete it from the pre-existing tags, change the tags, and/or you can add new tags. For example, in the poetry template there are "lg" and "l" tags, into which you can type or copy text.
